storyTitle: As Quoting Specialist, I want to receive real-time quote updates based on rating engine responses to achieve faster and accurate quoting

testCases.title: Validate real-time quote update on rating response
preconditions: User is logged in as Quoting Specialist with valid credentials
Quoting module UI is accessible and loaded
Rating engine API is available and responding
User has necessary role-based permissions to create quotes
Test quote data is prepared with valid inputs

steps.action: Navigate to the quote creation page in the Quoting module UI
steps.expectedResult: Quote creation page loads successfully with all input fields visible

steps.action: Enter valid quote data including customer information, product details, coverage amounts, and risk factors
steps.expectedResult: All quote data fields accept input without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Submit or Calculate Quote button to send data to rating engine
steps.expectedResult: Quote data is successfully sent to rating engine via POST /api/rate endpoint and loading indicator appears

steps.action: Observe the UI while rating engine processes the request
steps.expectedResult: Status indicator shows 'Calculating' or 'Processing' state during rating calculation

steps.action: Wait for rating engine response to be received by the system
steps.expectedResult: Rating response is received from the rating engine within 2 seconds

steps.action: Measure the time between receiving rating response and UI update
steps.expectedResult: Quote price updates on the UI within 1 second of receiving rating engine response

steps.action: Verify the updated quote display shows the calculated premium amount
steps.expectedResult: Correct price is displayed with proper formatting and currency symbol

steps.action: Check the status indicator after quote update completes
steps.expectedResult: Status shows 'Complete' or 'Ready' with green indicator or checkmark

steps.action: Review all quote details including breakdown of premium components if available
steps.expectedResult: All quote information is accurately displayed with correct calculations and status shown

postconditions: Quote is successfully rated and displayed in the UI
Quote status is set to 'Rated' or 'Complete'
Quote data is saved in the system for future reference
User can proceed to submit or adjust the quote

testCases.title: Verify error message display on rating failure
preconditions: User is logged in as Quoting Specialist with valid credentials
Quoting module UI is accessible and loaded
Test environment allows simulation of rating engine failures
User has necessary permissions to create and refresh quotes
Mock or test rating engine is configured to simulate failure scenarios

steps.action: Navigate to the quote creation page in the Quoting module UI
steps.expectedResult: Quote creation page loads successfully

steps.action: Enter valid quote data in all required fields
steps.expectedResult: Quote data is entered without validation errors

steps.action: Configure test environment or mock service to simulate rating engine failure response (e.g., 500 error, service unavailable)
steps.expectedResult: Rating engine is set to return failure response

steps.action: Click Submit or Calculate Quote button to trigger rating request
steps.expectedResult: Quote data is sent to rating engine and system awaits response

steps.action: Observe the UI when rating engine returns failure response
steps.expectedResult: Descriptive error message is displayed on UI indicating rating failure with clear explanation (e.g., 'Rating service temporarily unavailable. Please try again.')

steps.action: Verify the error message contains actionable information for the user
steps.expectedResult: Error message is user-friendly, non-technical, and suggests next steps

steps.action: Locate and click the manual refresh or retry button on the quote page
steps.expectedResult: Manual refresh button is visible and clickable

steps.action: Click the manual refresh button to retry the rating request
steps.expectedResult: System retries rating request by sending data to rating engine again

steps.action: Configure rating engine to return successful response for the retry attempt
steps.expectedResult: Rating engine is set to return valid rating response

steps.action: Observe the UI after successful rating response is received
steps.expectedResult: Error message is removed from the UI and quote price is displayed

steps.action: Verify the quote display shows correct price and status after successful update
steps.expectedResult: Quote displays accurate premium amount with 'Complete' status and no error messages visible

postconditions: Error handling mechanism is validated
Manual refresh functionality is confirmed working
Error messages are cleared after successful retry
Quote is successfully rated after retry
System logs contain error and retry events for troubleshooting

storyTitle: As QA Engineer, I want to test the integration with the policy rating engine to achieve reliable and accurate rating results

testCases.title: Validate rating accuracy for multiple products
preconditions: QA Engineer has access to test environment
Rating engine integration is deployed in test environment
Predefined test data sets are prepared for multiple product types
Expected rating outputs are documented based on actuarial benchmarks
API testing tool or automated test framework is configured
Test data includes various product types (e.g., auto, home, life insurance)

steps.action: Prepare test data sets with predefined inputs for Product Type 1 (e.g., Auto Insurance) including all required rating factors
steps.expectedResult: Test data set for Product Type 1 is complete with all necessary input parameters

steps.action: Send rating request to the rating engine API with Product Type 1 test data using POST /api/rate endpoint
steps.expectedResult: API request is sent successfully and returns HTTP 200 status code

steps.action: Capture and review the rating response received for Product Type 1
steps.expectedResult: Rating response contains premium amount, rating factors breakdown, and all expected fields

steps.action: Compare the received rating result against the expected output documented in actuarial benchmarks for Product Type 1
steps.expectedResult: Received rating matches expected output with zero discrepancies (within acceptable tolerance if defined)

steps.action: Prepare test data sets with predefined inputs for Product Type 2 (e.g., Home Insurance)
steps.expectedResult: Test data set for Product Type 2 is complete with all necessary input parameters

steps.action: Send rating request to the rating engine API with Product Type 2 test data
steps.expectedResult: API request is sent successfully and returns HTTP 200 status code

steps.action: Capture and review the rating response received for Product Type 2
steps.expectedResult: Rating response contains accurate premium calculation and all expected data fields

steps.action: Compare the received rating result against the expected output for Product Type 2
steps.expectedResult: Received rating matches expected output with no discrepancies found

steps.action: Repeat steps 5-8 for Product Type 3 and any additional product types in scope
steps.expectedResult: All product types return accurate ratings matching actuarial benchmarks

steps.action: Compile all test results including input data, received outputs, expected outputs, and comparison results
steps.expectedResult: Comprehensive test results are compiled in structured format

steps.action: Document test results in the test management system or test report with pass/fail status for each product type
steps.expectedResult: Results are documented for review with all test cases marked as PASS and available for stakeholder review

postconditions: Rating accuracy is validated for all tested product types
Test results are documented and stored in test repository
No discrepancies found between actual and expected ratings
Test evidence is available for audit and compliance purposes
QA sign-off can be provided for rating accuracy

testCases.title: Test system behavior under API timeout
preconditions: QA Engineer has access to test environment with admin privileges
Rating engine API integration is deployed and accessible
Test environment allows simulation of timeout scenarios
Mock service or network delay tool is configured to simulate timeouts
System logs are accessible for verification
Retry mechanism is implemented in the system
User interface is available to observe error notifications

steps.action: Configure the test environment or mock rating engine to simulate API timeout scenario (e.g., delay response beyond timeout threshold of 30 seconds)
steps.expectedResult: Test environment is configured to cause timeout when rating request is made

steps.action: Prepare valid test quote data with all required rating parameters
steps.expectedResult: Test data is ready with valid inputs for rating request

steps.action: Send rating request to the API endpoint POST /api/rate with the test data
steps.expectedResult: Rating request is sent to the API and system waits for response

steps.action: Monitor the system behavior when API timeout occurs after the configured timeout period
steps.expectedResult: System detects the timeout condition and triggers retry mechanism automatically

steps.action: Verify that the retry mechanism attempts to resend the rating request
steps.expectedResult: System initiates retry attempt as per configured retry policy (e.g., 3 retry attempts with exponential backoff)

steps.action: Navigate to the user interface where the quote is being processed
steps.expectedResult: UI is accessible and shows quote in processing state

steps.action: Observe the error notification displayed to the user after timeout and retry attempts
steps.expectedResult: Appropriate error message is displayed such as 'Rating service is taking longer than expected. Please try again later.' or similar user-friendly notification

steps.action: Verify the error message provides clear guidance and does not expose technical details
steps.expectedResult: Error notification is user-friendly, non-technical, and provides actionable guidance

steps.action: Access system logs or application logs to check for timeout event entries
steps.expectedResult: System logs are accessible and contain relevant timeout entries

steps.action: Search logs for timeout event with timestamp, request details, and error information
steps.expectedResult: Timeout event is logged with complete details including timestamp, request ID, endpoint, timeout duration, and error code

steps.action: Verify log entry contains sufficient information for troubleshooting including retry attempts
steps.expectedResult: Log entry includes all necessary details such as original request, retry attempts count, and final failure status

steps.action: Review that no sensitive data is exposed in error messages or logs
steps.expectedResult: Error messages and logs do not contain sensitive customer or system information

postconditions: Timeout handling mechanism is validated and working correctly
Retry mechanism is confirmed to trigger on timeout
Error notifications are user-friendly and informative
System logs contain complete timeout event details for troubleshooting
Test results are documented with evidence of timeout handling
System gracefully handles timeout scenarios without crashes or data corruption

storyTitle: As Business Analyst, I want to analyze rating engine integration requirements to achieve comprehensive documentation and stakeholder alignment

testCases.title: Verify completeness of requirements documentation
preconditions: Business Requirements Document (BRD) has been created and is accessible
User has appropriate access rights to view BRD documentation
Integration requirements gathering phase has been completed
Stakeholder interviews have been conducted

steps.action: Navigate to the Business Requirements Document repository and open the latest version of the rating engine integration BRD
steps.expectedResult: BRD document opens successfully and displays the table of contents with all sections visible

steps.action: Review the functional requirements section of the BRD for integration requirements
steps.expectedResult: All functional requirements are documented with clear descriptions, requirement IDs, and acceptance criteria. Each requirement includes purpose, scope, and business value

steps.action: Review the non-functional requirements section including performance, security, scalability, and availability requirements
steps.expectedResult: All non-functional requirements are present with measurable criteria and specific thresholds defined (e.g., response time < 2 seconds, 99.9% uptime)

steps.action: Navigate to the dependencies section and check documentation for system dependencies, data dependencies, and external service dependencies
steps.expectedResult: All dependencies are clearly identified with dependency type, description, impact analysis, and mitigation strategies documented

steps.action: Review the constraints section for technical, business, regulatory, and resource constraints
steps.expectedResult: All constraints are documented with constraint type, description, and impact on implementation clearly stated

steps.action: Navigate to the stakeholder sign-off section and verify approval documentation
steps.expectedResult: Sign-off documents are available showing approval from all key stakeholders including Business Owner, Technical Lead, Security Team, and Compliance Officer with dates and signatures

steps.action: Check the document version history and change log
steps.expectedResult: Version history is complete with all revisions tracked, including date, author, and summary of changes

postconditions: Requirements documentation completeness has been verified
Any gaps or missing information have been identified and documented
Verification results are recorded for audit purposes

testCases.title: Validate requirement change management process
preconditions: Requirements change management system is accessible and operational
User has permissions to submit and review change requests
At least one approved requirement exists in the BRD
Change request template and workflow are defined

steps.action: Access the requirements change management system and navigate to the 'Submit Change Request' section
steps.expectedResult: Change request submission form is displayed with all required fields visible (Requirement ID, Change Description, Justification, Impact Analysis, Priority)

steps.action: Select an existing requirement from the BRD (e.g., REQ-INT-001) and fill in the change request form with: Change Description: 'Update API response time from 2 seconds to 1 second', Justification: 'Business requirement for improved user experience', Impact: 'Medium', Priority: 'High'
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept input correctly and validation messages appear for any required fields if left empty

steps.action: Attach supporting documentation (business justification document) and submit the change request
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation message 'Change Request CR-2024-001 has been successfully submitted' and assigns a unique change request ID

steps.action: Navigate to the change request tracking dashboard and search for the newly submitted change request using the CR ID
steps.expectedResult: Change request is displayed in the tracking system with status 'Pending Review', submission date, submitter name, and all entered details are accurately reflected

steps.action: Verify that automated notifications were sent to designated reviewers (Technical Lead, Business Owner)
steps.expectedResult: Email notifications are logged in the system showing notification sent to all required reviewers with timestamp

steps.action: As a reviewer, access the change request and add review comments: 'Technical feasibility confirmed. Requires infrastructure upgrade.'
steps.expectedResult: Comments are saved successfully and timestamp with reviewer name is recorded

steps.action: Update the change request status to 'Approved' and provide approval justification
steps.expectedResult: Change request status updates to 'Approved', approval date and approver details are recorded, and status change is reflected in the tracking dashboard

steps.action: Submit another change request and update its status to 'Rejected' with rejection reason: 'Does not align with current business priorities'
steps.expectedResult: Change request status updates to 'Rejected', rejection reason is saved, and submitter receives notification of rejection with reason

steps.action: Generate a change request summary report for all submitted change requests
steps.expectedResult: Report displays all change requests with their current status, submission date, review date, and decision outcome in a clear tabular format

postconditions: Change requests are logged and tracked in the system
Change request statuses reflect the review decisions
Audit trail of all change management activities is maintained
Approved changes are ready for implementation planning

storyTitle: As System Administrator, I want to manage access controls for rating engine integration components to achieve secure and compliant operations

testCases.title: Verify role-based access enforcement
preconditions: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) system is configured and operational
At least two user accounts exist: one with 'Integration_Admin' role (authorized) and one with 'Read_Only' role (unauthorized)
Rating engine API endpoints are deployed and accessible
Test API endpoint '/api/rating-engine/config' requires 'Integration_Admin' role
Access logging is enabled and functioning
Valid authentication tokens are available for both test users

steps.action: Authenticate as user 'admin_user01' with 'Integration_Admin' role and obtain authentication token
steps.expectedResult: Authentication successful, valid JWT token is returned with role 'Integration_Admin' embedded in claims

steps.action: Send GET request to protected API endpoint '/api/rating-engine/config' using the authorized user's authentication token in the Authorization header
steps.expectedResult: HTTP 200 OK response is returned with configuration data in JSON format. Response includes rating engine configuration parameters

steps.action: Verify the response payload contains expected configuration data fields (engine_version, rate_tables, calculation_rules)
steps.expectedResult: All expected configuration fields are present and populated with valid data

steps.action: Authenticate as user 'readonly_user01' with 'Read_Only' role and obtain authentication token
steps.expectedResult: Authentication successful, valid JWT token is returned with role 'Read_Only' embedded in claims

steps.action: Send GET request to the same protected API endpoint '/api/rating-engine/config' using the unauthorized user's authentication token
steps.expectedResult: HTTP 403 Forbidden response is returned with error message: 'Access Denied: Insufficient permissions to access this resource. Required role: Integration_Admin'

steps.action: Verify that no configuration data is returned in the error response payload
steps.expectedResult: Response body contains only error details without exposing any sensitive configuration information

steps.action: Access the system access logs dashboard and filter logs for the API endpoint '/api/rating-engine/config' for the last 10 minutes
steps.expectedResult: Access logs dashboard displays filtered results showing recent access attempts to the specified endpoint

steps.action: Verify the log entry for the authorized user's successful access attempt
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows: Timestamp (within last 10 minutes), User ID 'admin_user01', Role 'Integration_Admin', Endpoint '/api/rating-engine/config', HTTP Method 'GET', Status Code '200', IP Address, and Session ID

steps.action: Verify the log entry for the unauthorized user's denied access attempt
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows: Timestamp (within last 10 minutes), User ID 'readonly_user01', Role 'Read_Only', Endpoint '/api/rating-engine/config', HTTP Method 'GET', Status Code '403', IP Address, Session ID, and Denial Reason 'Insufficient permissions'

steps.action: Export the access log entries for both attempts in CSV format
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is generated successfully containing both log entries with all required fields in structured format

postconditions: Access control enforcement has been verified for both authorized and unauthorized scenarios
All access attempts are logged with complete details
No unauthorized access to sensitive endpoints occurred
Audit trail is maintained for compliance review

testCases.title: Validate access review reporting
preconditions: Access logging system has been operational for at least one month
Historical access data exists for the last 30 days
User has 'System_Administrator' role with permissions to generate access reports
Access review reporting module is configured and accessible
At least 50 access events have been logged in the past month across different users and endpoints

steps.action: Log in to the system administration portal with System Administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Successfully logged in and administration dashboard is displayed with 'Access Review Reports' menu option visible

steps.action: Navigate to 'Access Review Reports' section and select 'Generate Monthly Access Report' option
steps.expectedResult: Report generation form is displayed with date range selector, filter options, and report format selection

steps.action: Set the report parameters: Date Range: 'Last Month' (auto-populates to previous calendar month), Include: 'All Users', 'All Endpoints', 'All Access Types', Report Format: 'PDF with Summary'
steps.expectedResult: All parameters are set correctly and validation shows no errors. Date range displays specific start and end dates

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' button and wait for report processing
steps.expectedResult: Progress indicator shows report generation in progress. After processing (30-60 seconds), success message appears: 'Access Report Generated Successfully' with download link

steps.action: Download and open the generated access report PDF
steps.expectedResult: PDF report opens successfully and displays report header with: Report Title 'Monthly Access Review Report', Date Range, Generation Date, Generated By (admin username)

steps.action: Review the Executive Summary section of the report
steps.expectedResult: Summary section includes: Total Access Events count, Unique Users count, Successful Access count, Failed Access count, Top 5 Most Accessed Endpoints, Access by Role breakdown (pie chart), and Access Trend graph (daily access over the month)

steps.action: Review the Detailed Access Events section showing all access events in tabular format
steps.expectedResult: Table includes columns: Timestamp, User ID, User Name, Role, Endpoint, HTTP Method, Status Code, IP Address, Session ID, and Duration. All entries are sorted by timestamp (most recent first)

steps.action: Navigate to the 'Anomalies and Security Alerts' section of the report
steps.expectedResult: Section displays identified anomalies including: Multiple failed login attempts (threshold: >5 failures in 1 hour), After-hours access (access between 10 PM - 6 AM), Access from unusual IP addresses, Privilege escalation attempts, and Unusual access patterns

steps.action: Review flagged anomaly: 'User readonly_user02 attempted to access admin endpoint 15 times with 403 errors on 2024-01-15'
steps.expectedResult: Anomaly entry shows: Severity Level 'High', User Details, Timestamp Range, Endpoint Attempted, Number of Attempts, Status Codes, and Recommended Action 'Investigate potential unauthorized access attempt and review user permissions'

steps.action: Check the 'Compliance Summary' section at the end of the report
steps.expectedResult: Compliance section shows: RBAC Enforcement Rate (100% expected), Access Logging Coverage (100% expected), Policy Violations count, and Compliance Status 'Compliant' or 'Non-Compliant' with details

steps.action: Export the detailed access events data in CSV format using the 'Export to CSV' option
steps.expectedResult: CSV file downloads successfully containing all access events with same columns as PDF report, suitable for further analysis in spreadsheet applications

steps.action: Verify report archival by checking the 'Report History' section
steps.expectedResult: Generated report appears in Report History with generation date, report type, date range covered, generated by user, and download link for future reference

postconditions: Monthly access report has been successfully generated and reviewed
Anomalies have been identified and flagged for investigation
Report is archived in the system for compliance and audit purposes
CSV export is available for detailed analysis
Follow-up actions for identified anomalies are documented
